column4: My touchpad stops working after sleep. Is there a way to force-detect and make it working again?
It sucks to have to always reboot my laptop when I close the lid :S
you shouldn't you need the edit the lid part i gconf-editer then power
would you like to know how to fix this?
Yes please! Great news :)
yup
the hit aft-f2 then tyop gconf-editor and open it
yup :)
go tp apps-gnome power manager the buttons
yup?
change the lidsc and lid battery to do nothong by doble clicking to edit. then close go to your power gui and lok at the lid buttons should be a do nothing or nothing there.
Oh... but doesnt that make the computer not sleep when I close the lid?
adds nothing to the lid controls in power
do you have your lid set to hibernate rather then sleep is that the problem.
I think it was set to suspend before I changed to "Do nothing"
Nope. Touchpad still dies when I suspend the computer
ah touchpad so it dies so you can restart with it? does the touchpad work after woken up?
Nope. Touchpad is always dead after woke up. If I plug in a USB mouse it works fine. But I have to reboot to get the touchpad working again :S
I have seen this problem posted on occasion at the Ubuntu Forums a search on google with the forum name and the problem may get you some more info as well.
Yeah. I'm gonna dig :) Thanks a lot for the help so far :)
I wish I knew an answer I have mine turned off lol.;)
